answers.answer: It's a little more complex than that.  An ophthalmologist in your area can help you to look into the underlying cause of your problem.  Yes, lubricants like good, preservative free artificial tears and lubricant ointments are generally a good idea, but you may need a more aggressive approach which might include punctum plugs, restasis drops, oral supplements such as flax and fish oil, identification and treatment of any contributing eyelid disorders, and looking into any oral medications, or systemic diseases  that may be worsening the situation.Michael Kutryb, MD
